Retrieves auxiliary information about pending DSP operations.

comments: Diagnostic peak-to-peak sine wave generator.
Reads diagnostic register, and return it
Write Test Register
Reads DSP copyright string. Read bytes from DSP until you get a zero byte. Result is an ASCIIZ copyright string.

Determines DSP major and minor version. Read major, minor from DSP.
SoundBlaster 1.0 = 1.?? (1.05???)
SoundBlaster 1.5 = 1.?? (1.05???)
SoundBlaster 2.0 = 2.xx (2.01)
SoundBlaster Pro = 3.00 (???)
SoundBlaster Pro 2 = 3.01+ (3.01, 3.02)
SoundBlaster 16 = 4.0x (4.04, 4.05)
SoundBlaster 16 SCSI-2 = 4.11 (4.11)
SoundBlaster AWE32 = 4.12+ (4.12)
Returns bitwise NOT of data byte.\nResults reliable only after DSP reset on early models.
Terminates auto-initialized 8-bit DMA operations after current block.
Terminates auto-initialized 16-bit DMA operation after current block.
Determines current status of speaker. Returned byte is enabled=0xFF, disabled=0x00
Continues any halted 16-bit DMA operation.
Pauses any 16-bit DMA operation.
Continues a halted 8-bit single-cycle DMA operation.
Disables speaker output.
Enables speaker output.
Pauses 8-bit single-cycle DMA operation.
Selects stereo input mode on SoundBlaster Pro.
Selects monaural input mode on SoundBlaster Pro.
Initiates 8-bit DMA transfer (record, >23KHz).\nHigh speed mode ignores DSP commands during transfers (<SB16).
Initiates 8-bit DMA transfer (>23KHz).\nHigh speed mode ignores DSP commands during transfers (<SB16).\nUse command 0Cxh to avoid SoundBlaster 16 quantization errors.
Outputs block of silent samples at current sample rate, and signals IRQ when complete.
Initiates auto-initialize 2.6-bit ADPCM DMA transfer with reference byte.\nExit auto-initialized mode by programming single-cycle DMA output or with Exit Auto-Initialize DMA Operation, 8-bit (0DAh).
Initiates auto-initialize 4-bit ADPCM DMA transfer with reference byte.\nExit auto-initialized mode by programming single-cycle DMA output or with Exit Auto-Initialize DMA Operation, 8-bit (0DAh).

effect: Initiates 2.6-bit ADPCM DMA transfer with new reference byte. This operation uses 8-bit DMA mode.
comments: Supports up to 13KHz on SoundBlaster 1.x

effect: Initiates 2.6-bit ADPCM DMA transfer with accumulated reference byte. This operation uses 8-bit DMA mode.
comments: Supports up to 13KHz on SoundBlaster 1.x

effect: Initiates 4-bit ADPCM DMA transfer with new reference byte. This operation uses 8-bit DMA mode.
comments: Supports up to 12KHz on SoundBlaster 1.x

effect: Initiates 4-bit ADPCM DMA transfer with accumulated reference byte. This operation uses 8-bit DMA mode.
comments: Supports up to 12KHz on SoundBlaster 1.x
Set DMA transfer size for auto-initialize and high speed modes.

effect: Continues a halted auto-initialized 16-bit DMA operation.
Continues a halted auto-initialized 8-bit DMA operation.

comments: Sets sample rate (in HZ)
Sets sample rate through internal I/O transfer timer.\n\nTimeConstant = 256 - (1000000 / (SampleChannels * SampleRate))
Writes MIDI code.

effect: MIDI Read Timestamp Interrupt + Write Poll (UART)
comments:
Enables UART mode with interrupt, where all DSP writes are interpreted as MIDI codes and interrupts are generated when a timestamped MIDI code is to be read.

Disable UART mode with DSP reset.
Write buffer status must still be checked.
SoundBlasters buffer up to 64bytes of MIDI data.

Enables UART mode with interrupt, where all DSP writes are interpreted as MIDI codes and interrupts are generated when a MIDI code is to be read.

Disable UART mode with DSP reset.
Write buffer status must still be checked.
SoundBlasters buffer up to 64bytes of MIDI data.

Enables UART mode, where all DSP read/writes are interpreted as MIDI codes.

Send MIDI Read Poll + Write Poll (UART) command (034h).
Send and receive MIDI codes.
Reset DSP to terminate

Generates interrupt when MIDI code is available, includes timestamp.

Timestamp if 24-bit value containing the time since the last MIDI command in milliseconds.
SoundBlasters buffer up to 64bytes of MIDI data.
Reads MIDI code with timestamp.\nRead timestamp and MIDI code when available
Generates interrupt when MIDI code is available.
Reads MIDI code.

Initiates auto-initialize 8-bit DMA transfer (record)\nSupports up to 23KHz (11.5KHz stereo).\nExit auto-initialized mode by programming single-cycle DMA output or with Exit Auto-Initialize DMA Operation, 8-bit (0DAh).
After this point, every read grabs a sample from the ADC. Terminate operation with DSP reset.
Initiates 8-bit DMA transfer (record).
Inputs single sample. Read sample from DSP
Initiates auto-initialize 2-bit ADPCM DMA transfer with reference byte.
Supports up to 23KHz (11.5KHz stereo)
Initiates 2-bit ADPCM DMA transfer with new reference byte. This operation uses 8-bit DMA mode.
Initiates 2-bit ADPCM DMA transfer with accumulated reference byte. This operation uses 8-bit DMA mode.
Initiates 8-bit DMA transfer. Single cycle.
Outputs single sample.

Retrieves information about pending DSP operations.
Bit 7: DMA DAC 8-bit (1=active)
Bit 6: DMA DAC 4-bit ADPCM (1=active)
Bit 5: DMA DAC 2.6-bit ADPCM (1=active)
Bit 4: DMA DAC 2-bit ADPCM (1=active)
Bit 3: Direct DAC 8-bit Burst
Bit 2: Reserved (0)
Bit 1: Stereo ADC Status (1=active)
Bit 0: Speaker status (1=active)
Read status (contents unknown)
